citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two adult female dogs (#63 Bichon-Poodle DOB 2-20-19 and #121 Mini party poodle DOB 1-28-23) were seen
occasionally shaking their heads during inspection. A closer look at their ears found that #121 had a dark slightly odorous
material in both ears and #63 had a slight amount of the same material in her right ear. The condition of these dogs' ears
had not been observed by the facility and wasn't under treatment. Dogs shaking their heads with darker material in the ear
that has an odor to it suggests something is irritating their ears. Ensuring that all dogs' ears are looked at closer if they are
shaking their heads and contacting the attending veterinarian (AV) for treatment directions can help prevent discomfort in
affected dogs' ears.
Ensure that a routine of daily observing each dog's behavior is in place and contact the AV for treatment instructions for
these two affected dogs and follow the AV's treatment instructions.
***Correct by 7/11/2024.

Two different litters were sold and picked up by a buyer that were not at least 8 weeks (56 days) old. A litter of 4 golden
retriever puppies (DOB 3-16-24) were picked up on 5-10-24 (55 days old). A litter of 7 mixed breed puppies (DOB 4-28-
24) were sold and picked up by the buyer on 6-21-24 (54 days old). For optimum puppy health and per the regulations
puppies must be at least 8 weeks old or older and weaned prior to being sold and transported in commerce. Ensure that
puppies are at least 56 days old and weaned before allowing them to be transported in commerce.
***Correct from 7/10/2024 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two adult female dogs (#63 Bichon-Poodle DOB 2-20-19 and #121 Mini party poodle DOB 1-28-23) were seen 
occasionally shaking their heads during inspection. A closer look at their ears found that #121 had a dark slightly odorous 
material in both ears and #63 had a slight amount of the same material in her right ear. The condition of these dogs' ears 
had not been observed by the facility and wasn't under treatment. Dogs shaking their heads with darker material in the ear 
that has an odor to it suggests something is irritating their ears. Ensuring that all dogs' ears are looked at closer if they are 
shaking their heads and contacting the attending veterinarian (AV) for treatment directions can help prevent discomfort in 
affected dogs' ears.  
Ensure that a routine of daily observing each dog's behavior is in place and contact the AV for treatment instructions for 
these two affected dogs and follow the AV's treatment instructions.  
***Correct by 7/11/2024. 
2.130 
   
Minimum age requirements. 
Two different litters were sold and picked up by a buyer that were not at least 8 weeks (56 days) old. A litter of 4 golden 
retriever puppies (DOB 3-16-24) were picked up on 5-10-24 (55 days old). A litter of 7 mixed breed puppies (DOB 4-28-
24) were sold and picked up by the buyer on 6-21-24 (54 days old). For optimum puppy health and per the regulations 
puppies must be at least 8 weeks old or older and weaned prior to being sold and transported in commerce. Ensure that 
puppies are at least 56 days old and weaned before allowing them to be transported in commerce.  
***Correct from 7/10/2024 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
